I couldn't get on with the original chords starting in C but found this
version in an easy piano chords book. This is not a perfect version by any
means but it translates quite well to guitar. I've typed out some
instructions as I've experienced how frustrating it is to fathom out how
best to play the chords for this song if you're not a particularly
experienced guitarist.

Capo 3rd Fret

Verse One:

Start in A (002220), bar the 2nd fret for the Bm7 (224232), up 2 frets for
the C#m7 (446454), then up one fret for the Dmaj7 (557675) which allows you
to run straight back down the C#m7 then Bm7. The second line is easy open
chords with A (002220), Em7 (020000) to A7 (002020) then Dmaj7 (x00222)
followed by the G9 (300003). The third line is A (002220) then G9 (300003)
then bar the 2nd fret for the F#m7 (242222) then bar the 6th fret for the
Ebm7 (668676) straight down one fret to the D7 (557575) then start the last
line- down one fret to the C#maj7 (446564) then up one fret for the Dm7
(557565) then back to open chords for the G9 (300003) and Cmaj7 (332000)
then finally bar the 2nd fret for the Bm7 (224232) and down one fret for the
[ch]Bbmaj7[/ch] (113231).

Verse Two:

The first three lines are the same as verse one however the last line is
different. So after the D7 (557575) at the end of the 3rd line you start the
rundown barring the 4th fret for C#m7 (446454) down one fret to Cmaj7
(335453) then down another fret to Bm7 (224232) then one more fret to Bbmaj7
(113231) and finally ending on the standard A chord (002220).

Bridge:

The line starts on the A chord as ending on the 2nd verse then a standard
Em7 (020000) then A7 (002020) and then Dmaj7 (x00222) staying on this chord
for the start of the second line before going back to the Em7 (020000) then
A7 (002020) then Dmaj7 (x00222). Stay on this chord for the start of
the third line before going to Dm7 (x00211) then G7 (320001) and then Cmaj7
(332000) then the last line is a B7 (x21202) and E7 (020100).

Verse Three:

The first three lines are the same as verse one however the last line is
different. So after the D7 (557575) at the end of the 3rd line you start the
rundown barring the 4th fret for C#m7 (446454) down one fret to Cmaj7
(335453) then down another fret to Bm7 (224232) then an open E7 (020100) and
finally ending on the standard A chord (002220).

content.text:
Song: A horse with no name
Artist: America
Composer: Dewey Bunnell
Album: America

Tabbed by DJ ('DiddyD' at ultimateGuitar.com)
10th Oct 2016

This chord version is based on Gerry Beckley's 12 string
rhythm guitar part. I think it sounds better for a single
guitar than Dewey Bunnell's 2 chord pattern which had the
benefit of Dan Peek's and Gerry's guitars to back it up.

Dewey Bunnell just used a couple of chords throughout:
Emadd9 = 022002 and D6/9(F# bass)= 200202

Gerry's 12 string was tuned down a tone to D-G-C-F-A-D,
and then a capo at the 2nd fret brought it back up to normal
concert pitch (This was just standard practise to take the
pressure off the guitar neck) There is no need for a capo
or detuning to play this on a six string, the chords are just
the same.

N.B.
Please ignore any pop-up chord boxes the website might suggest
and use the typed shapes shown below.

[ch]Em[/ch] = 022000  [ch]Em9[/ch] = 020032  [ch]F#m11[/ch] = x44200  [ch]A6sus2[/ch] = x04200

F#m11  = 244200 (This is also an option if you want to add
                 the F# bass with your thumb)

Please select a star rating for this tab, many thanks

==============================================================

[Intro]
  [ch]Em[/ch]    [ch]Em9[/ch]      [ch]F#m11[/ch]  [ch]A6sus2[/ch]   [ch]Em[/ch]   [ch]Em9[/ch]      [ch]F#m11[/ch]  [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
|  /  /  /  /  |  /  /  /  /  |  /  /  /  /  |  /  /  /  /  |

[Verse 1]
        [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]Em9[/ch]    [ch]F#m11[/ch]    [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
On the first part of the journey,
        [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]Em9[/ch]    [ch]F#m11[/ch]    [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
I was looking at all the life,
            [ch]Em[/ch]         [ch]Em9[/ch]        [ch]F#m11[/ch]      [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
There were plants, and birds, and rocks, and things,
            [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]Em9[/ch]       [ch]F#m11[/ch]    [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
There were sand, and hills, and rings!

[Verse 2]
     [ch]Em[/ch]           [ch]Em9[/ch]       [ch]F#m11[/ch]      [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
The first thing I met was a fly with a buzz,
        [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]Em9[/ch]     [ch]F#m11[/ch]    [ch]A6sus2[/ch]
And the sky ...with no clouds,
